paper_abstract: Let (omega(n))(0<n) be the sequence known as Integer Sequence A047749 In this paper, we show that the integer omega(n) enumerates various kinds of symmetric structures of order two. We first consider ternary trees having a reflexive symmetry and we relate all symmetric combinatorial objects by means of bijection. We then generalize the symmetric structures and correspondences to an infinite family of symmetric objects.
paper_title: On symmetric structures of order two
